review_title: A graduate assistantship with a healthy modicum of control over the syllabus in the second year.
job_title: Graduate Assistant in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Most importantly it's an inroad to experience teaching at the collegiate level. The teaching load is limited to a 1-1 teaching load in the first year and a 1-2 load the second year. I was quite happy with the opportunities provided and learned a great deal.
cons: The bar for student selectivity at the university is relatively low, so oftentimes unnecessary time is spent teaching students skill they should have picked up in high school. A great deal of time is often consumed focused on teaching courses, but this is really just the nature of an assistantship.

job_title: in Bowling Green, OH
pros: The benefits afforded to employees. The amount of autonomy employees can exercise. Pleasant place to live if you like experiencing all four seasons.
cons: The sport teams aren't very good and as a result there isn't very much team spirit among the students. Getting senior staff to take you serious is difficult. There have been times when we learn about changes at the same time as or from students, which can be frustrating.

job_title: Instructor in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Great students. Collegial faculty. New faculty association contract. Eclectic town with affordable housing, nice restaurants and bars. Close to Toledo.
cons: Board of Trustees, president, provost and administration that have long forgotten their mission to teach students. They pump money into dorms, rec center and athletics, but have forgotten about learning. They continue to increase their own salaries while cutting almost 15 percent of the faculty in the past two years. One of lowest paid faculty in state. Subpar teaching facilities. Lack of support for most programs - except business, athletics. Faculty still work hard despite recent setbacks, but morale is starting to dwindle and some are abandoning ship.

review_title: Full-time Graduate Student with Part-time Assistantship working for the university
job_title: Graduate Assistant in Bowling Green, OH
pros: My program, American Culture Studies, and the school it resides in has some great faculty. I was able to teach my own courses and gain experience in university administration. The town is cheap to live in.
cons: I feel this university is no longer strongly supporting graduate education. When I came here we were allowed to take many more courses under our funding package that we are now and had fewer fees to pay. The new student health center is a rip-off. A visit will cost a student $60 even with the school's health insurance.

job_title: Desk Clerk/Night Guard in Bowling Green, OH
pros:
I worked on campus for Residence Life as a Desk Clerk/Night Guard at Harshman Chapman-Dunbar.

Staff was always fun, working the night shift was great. You could switch with anyone if you wanted to take the night off, schedule times that best worked for you. If you live in the halls its easy to get to work, just go downstairs or take a few minutes to walk across campus.

Tons of people to meet and tons of things to do if you're into college lifestyle. Campus is nice, the general area is nice as well and close to the highway.
cons: Have to work with Freshmen a lot. Typical college town, sports bars and dive bars.

job_title: in Bowling Green, OH
pros: The stipend is decent for a PhD program. The teaching and course load is relatively low and you have a lot of time to devote to research. There is always good parking within a 2-4 minute walk of my building.
cons: BGSU does not have as many resources as other, larger institutions. The stipend doesn't cover health insurance or any fees associated with taking classes (upwards of $900 per semester).

job_title: Advisor in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Every office feels like a small family, people are so nice to each other, and when there is a problem, we strive to fix it as fast as possible. Getting to work with students every day is one of the highlights of this job. I feel like I am treated like a person, not just an employee here.
cons: Sometimes it can feel overwhelming with the amount of students that need advising help. I wish we were able to get one more advisor in each college office.

job_title: Administrating Graduate Assistant in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Community is strong, the surrounding area has a lot to do, housing is extremely cheap, athletics are affordable (free for students, cheap for non-students), campus has a small footprint; can walk between any two points within 10-15 minutes.
cons: The weather is unbearable some days. Currently a lot of construction every year, often closing parking options. Seems odd but, a lot of the parking lots have a steep turn in which your car will scrape when entering or exiting. It takes a toll. Parking can be tough sometimes.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Excellent working environment, great professor and nice colleagues. When you are working, you just feel like working with many friends and communicate some ideas you both interested in.
cons: If you are not a lab-guy, you might feel boring when you spend all day in a electronic lab. But if you are not a easy-boring guy, I think working in a lab is a good thing.

job_title: Instructor in Bowling Green, OH
pros:
BGSU has a dedicated faculty that really focuses on helping students learn. While I can't speak for the politics of every department, overall there is a very collegial atmosphere. Despite some adverse conditions and a labor dispute, faculty continue to work to make this place great.

While many programs don't have great resources (see below), they still do a good job to prepare students -- if a student is willing to work.

We may not get the "best" students in terms of GPA and test scores, but our student body is diverse and hard working. Most students are pleasant, and a few are real gems waiting to be mentored.

While BGSU is the center of the community, BG has its own culture and many things to offer. It is a good place to live and raise a family. Toledo is a short drive away. Ann Arbor, Cleveland, Columbus are all relatively close for day trips.
cons:
Low faculty pay. Second worst among all state schools in Ohio - just above Shawnee State.

Administrative bloat. The school recently cut 100 jobs, which will make it near one administrator for every faculty member. The administration is more concerned with new facilities (and their own pay) than educating students.

Administration has been  dragged kicking and screaming into contract negotiations with new faculty union and is using every stall tactic it can. Admin recently announced job cuts to the media before telling many employees that their job was cut. You feel like a number sometimes.

Many facilities are in dire need of an upgrade. Some are "on the list"-- but only after a new administrative building is erected, of course. Classroom computers are mostly PCs with old versions of Window and antiquated projection systems. There are some gems, but those are few.

job_title: Admissions Counselor in Bowling Green, OH
pros: The people at BGSU are incredible and the Admissions Office is a productive, positive and energizing place to work.  It was a friendly and encouraging environment very conducive to cultivating strong professional relationships and the professional development opportunities were exceptional!
cons: The only con that I could think of is that since it was such a great place to work there were a lot of folks in leadership roles that had been there for quite a while which prompted there to be less regular opportunities to advance/be promoted.

review_title: Is OK but has some issues
job_title: Specialist in Bowling Green, OH
pros:
Most of the work is easy.
They have very flexible hours, so that you can work in between classes.
My pay is above minimum
cons:
Part time has a 28 hour limit for work, this is a combination of all BGSU jobs
All most all of the jobs pay minimum wage.
Very little room for advancement.
For a student part time employee you must have a least 6 credit hours.
Most places only have the hours of 7:30 to 5.

job_title: Resident Advisor in Bowling Green, OH
pros: You gain relevant experience that you can relate to any job. The Office of Residence Life at BGSU prepares you for many different unexpected crisis situations and helps you gain important contacts around campus. In addition, you'll gain a great group of staff members.
cons:
You work 24/7 

You'll need excellent time management skills and will need to prioritize everything in your schedule.

review_title: Good place to work, but pay and benefits are one of the lowest in the state for public higher education.
job_title: Professor in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Colleagial atmosphere; safe college town environment; near Toledo where there is a great art museum and zoo; Div. I athletics programs and sports clubs for students, among other academic and social organizations.
cons: Pay and benefits are second lowest in comparison to other state public institutions of higher education. Somewhat adversarial attitude of the administration with the faculty.

job_title: Tutor in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Working part-time with the Math in Action Tutoring Hub was a wonderful decision on my part. Flexible hours, low maintenance job. I love it.
cons: I don't get many hours - but this is not my "career" job. This is simply a job I have to pass my time as a student, so they work well with student schedules.

job_title: Web Production Manager in Huron, OH
pros: Getting to work with a variety of talented, educated and creative people from all walks of life makes for a dynamic and vibrant workplace.
cons: Wanting to serve the educational needs of the state of Ohio can often be held hostage to the political winds and whims of the State Government.

job_title: IT Desktop Support in Bowling Green, OH
pros:
Multiple avenues for learning new and currently established systems in an education setting.
Well rounded staff with a multitude of strengths that can provide assistance in many scenarios.
Open communication regarding management, always free to sit down and discuss current issues or questions/concerns.
cons: No real issue stands out, overall very positive!

review_title: I had an excellent graduate career at BGSU.
job_title: Graduate Assistant in Bowling Green, OH
pros:
The faculty is very personable.
There are a number of resources available to students of all backgrounds.
Financial aid, particularly for graduate students, is quite good.
Everything is within walking distance.
cons:
It is a college town, which means there isn't a whole lot to do besides work and be a student there.
Being in the Midwest, it can get very cold and windy quite early in the year, and it lasts a long time.

job_title: Senior Director in Bowling Green, OH
pros: benefits - health insurance, financial investments, savings plan, and that is all.  It is a struggle to come up with this many pros when there are too many cons to list.  It was a job, but not one I would ever take again.  Most of management does the basic minimum and they don't want to be outperformed by someone new.
cons: Poor environment, small town mentality, toxic people, no possibility of growth, lack of opportunity, people want to do minimum

job_title: Laboratory Technologist in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Good work environment, interactions at the departmental level are almost always positive. Issues that can be handled by the individual departments are generally acted upon quickly.
cons: Now that they have instituted pay caps, it no longer is a place to look at as a career. Consider working there as a stepping stone to another position some place else.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bowling Green, OH
pros: The community is dedicated to supporting students.  It is truly a pleasure to collaborate across campus with individuals who are competent and student-oriented.
cons: Continued budget cuts create a resource poor environment.  Faculty and staff are asked to perform more than can be realistically expected.

review_title: Don't Stay Here For Longer Than a Semester
job_title: Cashier in Bowling Green, OH
pros:
Some of the managers are nice.
You'll meet some friendly co-workers.
If you close, you can take home free food.
cons:
Managers have no backbone when it comes to employees; a lot of managers get bossed around by lower-level employees.
The older employees feel that gossiping is more important than the job itself.
A five-year-old has more organization than this business.

job_title: Student Supervisor in Bowling Green, OH
pros:
Flexible schedule 
caring staff 
great work environment with other students 

I loved working at the library as a student great people!
cons:
low wage & only part time 
They have to cap the amount of hours you can work which may lead some to get a second job. The pay isn't great but it is what it should be.

review_title: Research Assistant at the Department of Computer Science
job_title: Research Assistant in Bowling Green, OH
pros: I have worked as a graduate research assistant at the department of computer science for about two years.  I have learned a lot of things and I was able to improve my skills by working on assigned projects. It has a very friendly environment.
cons: You should work on most of the projects solely with little to no guidance.

review_title: Great opportunity that added leadership values.
job_title: Greek Housing Director in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Great college with deep roots in education and student relations. Very helpful faculty and staff that allowed for a good work environment.
cons:
Limited life outside of the job due to the hours needed.

Salary and benefits lacking.

Must stay on campus during weekends.

review_title: BGSU is the place to be
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bowling Green, OH
pros:
Small town with well developed sport and bar entertainment
Nice college, people are great and friendly.
cons: Not much but as a graduate student you have to pay ~$3500 per year for some fees including medical insurance, graduate fee, non resident fee.

review_title: Excellent place to work and earn a degree
job_title: Graduate Assistant in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Friendly faculty really willing to work with you to achieve goals academically and in work, understand that academics comes first and your obligations to them as a graduate assistant can be malleable around exams, etc.
cons: Stipends do not always allow for a great number of hours, although hourly rate is decent.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Bowling Green, OH
pros: My tuition is paid as part of the employee compensation.
cons: There was no or unclear direction on an ongoing basis.  The pay cycle and fee cycles make no sense. You are expected to pay HUNDREDS of dollars in fees, yet get paid weeks after it is due. Feels scammy at times. It is illogical.

review_title: It is a wonder full University to work with
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Flexible work hours. Can pick the classes you want to be involved in teaching assistant.
cons: If the professor is strict you then you got to be on time.

job_title: Desktop Support Tech in Bowling Green, OH
pros: People are nice, and the hours are great.  Really helps out their student workers and you learn a lot while on the job
cons: There aren't many downsides.  Sometimes you are asked to do things that aren't in the job requirements like set up labs, but its not so bad.

job_title: Professor in Largo, FL
pros: Colleagues I work with, especially in my area. Nice college town. Excellent technology support. Library facilities excellent as well as services and personnel.
cons: Conflicts with administration. Almost the lowest pay than other universities in Ohio. Cutback of funding for faculty lines and the firing of faculty, especially NTTF.

review_title: I really like this job.  It gives you a lot of on the job experience
job_title: Resident Advisor in Bowling Green, OH
pros: You get to gain experience, work with people, and lessen the costs of college.
cons: The administration can be difficult to work under, and there are a lot of restrictions.

job_title: Mid-career in Bowling Green, OH
pros: The people there are the nicest, most helpful, good-hearted people you will find anywhere.
cons: The upper administration is seriously out of touch, and the President is Crazy Mazey.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bowling Green, OH
pros: I loved working at the library. They were always so accommodating with my class schedule which made being able to manage a job while also being a student that much easier.
cons: None! I worked at the library as a research assistant for 3 years and it was more than enjoyable!

job_title: Assistant Professor in Bowling Green, OH
pros: Quality of life. Bowling Green is a stereotypical university town with nice people.
cons: Traditional academic environment.  Little encouragement or recognition for innovative ideas or practices. A great deal of pressure to conform to traditional tenure track behaviors.

job_title: Sales in Gardena, CA
pros: it is very fun to be at and the atomsphere is quite relaxed and kick back just like  you were at home

review_title: BGSU is all about politics and who know
